    Adds the record in the parameter to the database.

    Removes the row which matches the case number in the parameter
    void manualUpdate​(Record rec)
    Pass in a record class and it will delete the previous row of it in the database and add the new record class to simulate updating the row in the database.

  • Method Details

    • setDatabasePath

      public void setDatabasePath​(java.lang.String databasePath)
      Sets the static field databasePath to the given path so when the database in the new path will be accessed when creating a database connection
      Parameters:
      databasePath - a path to a database file

    • connectDatabase

      public void connectDatabase() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Gets connection to the database and then calls the create table function. Used when creating a database object and when the database path is changed
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • disconnectDatabase

      public void disconnectDatabase() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Closes the database connection. This is used to prevent database locked errors from open connections
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • deleteTable

      public void deleteTable​(java.lang.String tableName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Deletes every row in the given table in the database
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table for the records to be deleted from
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • createTable

      public void createTable() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates the main table in the database which stores the records and adds the columns listed in the columns field to it
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • insertRows

      public void insertRows​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> inputs) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.text.ParseException
      Gets an arrayList of string Lists and adds them to the database. Any empty values are entered as NULL type
      Parameters:
      inputs - an Arraylist of Lists of Strings that is passed into it from the CSV Reader
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.text.ParseException

    • replaceRows

      public void replaceRows​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> inputs) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.text.ParseException
      Deletes current table, then gets an arrayList of string Lists and adds them to the database. Any empty values are entered as NULL type
      Parameters:
      inputs - an Arraylist of Lists of Strings that is passed into it from the CSV Reader
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.text.ParseException

    • manualAdd

      public void manualAdd​(Record rec) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.text.ParseException
      Adds the record in the parameter to the database. It adds it to an arraylist of lists of strings so it can be parsed into the previously * made insertRows() method and reuse that code
      Parameters:
      rec - Record class object to be added to the database
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if a database error occurs
      java.text.ParseException

    • manualUpdate

      public void manualUpdate​(Record rec) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.text.ParseException
      Pass in a record class and it will delete the previous row of it in the database and add the new record class to simulate updating the row in the database. It adds it to an arraylist of lists of strings so it can be parsed into the previously made insertRows() method and reuse that code
      Parameters:
      rec - Record class object to be updated in the database
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.text.ParseException

    • manualDelete

      public void manualDelete​(java.lang.String caseNum) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Removes the row which matches the case number in the parameter
      Parameters:
      caseNum - pass in the case number for the row that will be deleted
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • extractCol

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> extractCol​(java.lang.String columnName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Extracts and returns valued of a column from Crime database table
      Parameters:
      columnName - String object representing the column name that is to be returned
      Returns:
      ColumnValues ArrayList
